activities:
Personal Information Received from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland:
AOL Inc. receives personal information regarding natural persons located in the EEA and/or Switzerland in connection with its various products and service offerings. AOL Inc.’s collection and processing of personal information from users varies according to the particular product or service being provided and its specific features. AOL’s offerings include portal services (such as AOL.com and The Huffington Post), social networking services, and advertising services (such as those offered by AOL Advertising). In connection with its various offerings, AOL may collect and process personal information for different purposes, including any of the following: to operate and improve websites, products and services; to personalize and serve content and advertisements across a variety of Internet and television platforms; to fulfill requests for products, programs, and services; to communicate with customers and respond to inquiries; to conduct research about use of AOL offerings; to help offer other products, programs, or services that may be of interest to users; and to comply with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies and with law. The privacy policies applicable to AOL offerings including AOL Portal, Huffington Post, and AOL Advertising services are located at http://privacy.aol.com. AOL Inc. employee, contractor, and job applicant information from the EEA and/or Switzerland is included in the safe harbor.
corpofftitle1: Vice President and Global Privacy Leader
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: online, offline, manually processed, human resources data
privacyprograms: The Direct Marketing Association (DMA) Safe Harbor Program
recoursemech: For non-HR data, AOL is a participant in The Direct Marketing Association (DMA) Safe Harbor Program.  For HR data only, AOL will cooperate with EEA data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
